column3: ADULTS & FAMILIES, meals, shelter, clothing, counseling, medical, dental & vision, spiritual services, disability services, senior program, computer classes & GED certification, anger management & alcohol recovery classes
column4:
Intake: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM, 7 days p/w
 Required: I.D., S.S., marriage license, children's birth certificates,military ID, gov ID

column3: ADULTS, substance abuse, domestic violence & veterans programs; life skills classes
column4:
Intake daily at 3:00 PM 'till full; usually within 1 hour! Line-up at least 1 hour ahead of time. Vets intake at VAhospital-screening office. 
 ID required. No sex predators

column3: ADULTS & FAMILIES, day shelter (laundry, mail, meals, etc.), emergency night shelter, mental health & recovery services, jail diversion/reentry, employment services, assistance with housing
ADULTS, emergency night shelter, meals Mon-Wed
column4: Open 6:30 PM - 8:00 AM Mon-Wed and *during inclement weather only (32° or below, 100° or above, or during severe storms)*
column5: 300 S. Woodrow        (940) 391-1919     www.kingoutreachcenter.com         or text Betty Kay

column3: ADULTS & FAMILIES, Men over 45, single women over 23, married couples & families, minimum 21-day stay, case management
column4: I.D. & background check required: Open 24 hours

column3: MEN, WOMEN, & CHILDREN, 175+ beds, faith-based service, various other services such as 10-month men new creation program, free clinic, and women & family shelter
column4: Can not be under the influence of drugs or alcohol
column5: Women & Family Shelter (903) 234 - 2583         Men Shelter              (903) 759 - 8101  http://hiway80rm.org/

column3: Single Men and Women, veteran services, mental health & substance abuse services, job training & placement program,
column4: Bring any identifying documents. Call (817) 632-7429 for prescreen. Overnight intakes Mon-Fri: Mens shelter: 2:30pm. Womens shelter: 2:00pm

column3: FAMILIES, INCLUDING SINGLE-PARENT FAMILIES, 24-hour temporary shelter, meals, transportation, case management and support services.
column5: (972) 442-6966 www.familypromiseofcollincounty.org                                  Can try #211 hotline too. Irving location: 972-313-1500

column3: YOUTH 5-17, RHY & CPS youth with basic, moderate, specialized, and intense levels of care, shelter for up to 90-days, siblings cottage, medical & dental, case management, life skills, long-term residential programs dependent on needs

CHILDREN 0-12 WITH MEDICAL OR DEVELOPMENTAL NEEDS, *NOT an emergency shelter, weekend respite care only*, *Respite offered 2 Sat's per month.  Special needs early childhood education program, summer program, case management, parent support groups.
column4: Must apply and qualify for services based on medical need and insurance.                                              Call (214) 559-3946 and speak to case manager to complete phone screen

column3: YOUTH 10-17, RHY & CPS youth, shelter up to 90 days, case management, medical services, educational services, life skills,
male exoffenders- Philemon's House    female offenders-Martha's House
